titleStmt.title: Description of University of Manchester Library, Gaster Hebrew MS 21: Remedies and prescriptions

notesStmt.note: Some text in Latin characters on folios 1a, 1b, 4b, 5a, 8a, 10a, 11a-b, 21a, 49b. Sporadic Tiberian vocalisation. Hebrew remedies are found on folios 12b-13b in a darker ink and perhaps a different hand; for the rest mostly in Yiddish with the occasional Hebrew word or phrase, most obviously קח ("take!") at the beginning of some prescriptions.

Water and fire damage. Folio 1 has been repaired in the outer and top margins with modern paper. Several folios have been torn and are missing some parts: folios 29, 33-35, 37, 49-50. Missing: one folio between folios 29 and 30 and possibly one between 39 and 40 and two folios between 50 and 51.

msContents.summary: Medical and magico-medical remedies and prescriptions. Between folios 1a and 57b there are approximately 312 texts, numbered in Hebrew 221-523 (רכא-תקכג). Some brief text in Latin characters, possibly in Latin and German.

msItem.title: Gaster Hebrew MS 21, [ff. 1a - 57b] Medical and magico-medical remedies and prescriptions

supportDesc.extent: i+57+i; 195 x 150 mm bound to 204 x 160 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern pencil foliation in Arabic numerals at the top outer corner of side a of each folio. Somewhat inconsistent Hebrew numbering of paragraphs.

layoutDesc.layout: Different layout throughout the codex, with frequent indication of paragraph and subtitle, with occasional graphic line.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi semi-cursive script, different hands (see e.g folios 22b-29b, 43a).

decoDesc.decoNote: Several end of paragraph signs throughout the manuscript (see e.g. folios 15a and 16a).
Inside front coverOn front paste-down in ink: copy of the jüddish part 968, 21 in blue pencil
Flyleaf 1aOn side a of front fly-leaf in black ink: והשבעות / וסגולות / רפואות / Hebrew and German! / XVI cent. / of utmost importance and value. / M-G.

binding.p: Modern black leather binding. Handwritten label on spine reading in Hebrew 21 / טייטש / עברי / סגולות / רפאות / [...]

origin.p: Produced in the sixteenth or seventeenth century.

history.provenance: Acquired by The John Rylands Library from the heirs of Moses Gaster, 1954.
